TopicTitle: KSP RP forum server CPU usage exceeded.

Articles.Content:
> 
> Are we allowed to put up satellites orbiting the Mun, or are we restricted to Kerbin for our time level? 
> 
> Also, does anyone know any modpacks that would be considered good for our current tech level? Otherwise, I\'m sticking with stock, modular missiles, railgun (To simulate various other weapons), and carts.

If it was possible in 1950\'s Earth with its technology, I\'m all for it.
50s was about the time of the Mercury missions, right?

I just did some research, and the first lunar orbit wasn\'t until around 1965, sadly... But in the late 50s the Soviets crashed a probe into the moon, so we can at least do that. I think the Mercury missions were either in the late 50s or early 60s.

EDIT: It seems like the most fun we\'ll have is the 60\'s, which is when we get Mun landings and orbits, more manned missions, et cetera. And while I\'m on the topic of manned missions - will we be able to launch a lot of manned rockets, or will we be restricted to mechjeb-type unmanned pods?

> 
> 50s was about the time of the Mercury missions, right?

Really, Mercury was 60\'s (1959-63), but because we need something to do besides launching V2\'s, I\'ll allow it.
Wait, *colonization?* Looks like I am drawing a map of future plans, then.
So we can do a lot of things around Kerbin, but we can\'t go to the Mun for two weeks? Okay, then.

> 
> So we can do a lot of things around Kerbin, but we can\'t go to the Mun for two weeks? Okay, then.

What I am betting on:

Colonies everywhere.

Lordwasteland invades UoSoV, madness ensures.

Independence wars for colonies occur

Popeter manages to beat the test, craziness ensures.

Somebody takes over half the world via uniting colonies, and then everyone else unites to take them down.

And finally, Atlaniego\'s experiments in nuclear energy end up in a massive crater, which doubles the size of the Jhazi Strait.

> 
> What I am betting on:
> 
> Colonies everywhere.
> 
> Lordwasteland invades UoSoV, madness ensures.
> 
> Independence wars for colonies occur
> 
> Popeter manages to beat the test, craziness ensures.
> 
> Somebody takes over half the world via uniting colonies, and then everyone else unites to take them down.
> 
> And finally, Atlaniego\'s experiments in nuclear energy end up in a massive crater, which doubles the size of the Jhazi Strait.

Wars are much more difficult to get into now. We won\'t be seeing a war for (I hope) a few weeks.

> 
> Wars are much more difficult to get into now. We won\'t be seeing a war for (I hope) a few weeks.

Let us see...

> 
> Can we grow our nations? I see an expansion to our south, and possibly the **destruction of the UoSoV...**

**\*Imandreas looks for domain name\***

> 
> Really, Mercury was 60\'s (1959-63), but because we need something to do besides launching V2\'s, I\'ll allow it.

Actually, the X-15, could do a suborbital approach, so manned spaceflight does apply in the late 50\'s. Also be warned, there may be people waiting for you. UoSoV, let\'s discuss our boundaries, for the south.

My plan is as follows:

First, I\'m going to spend the week and a half I\'ll have once this opens beefing up Lunus\'s infrastructure, technology, et cetera. Then I\'m going on a vacation then a mission trip for a total of two weeks, so I\'ll end up coming back in at the end of the 60s. I\'ll be really late to the Mun scene, but my nation will at least be ready for whatever I have to do to catch up.

I most likely will not be doing a moon mission myself, seeing that all my computers are broken forever, and it is hard for a thirteen year-old to scrape up money when the area has no work to be done.

EDIT: Rough map of sea-based trade routes for current nations. Note it is VERY BAD, and was made just for yelling/praise. Sorry, Makavi and Rigitiem, but I really need to add more to both of your nations.

> ![ksp_rp_trademap1_by_imandreasksp-d53zp7b.jpg](http://fc07.deviantart.net/fs70/f/2012/169/3/6/ksp_rp_trademap1_by_imandreasksp-d53zp7b.jpg)
I noticed that your trade route map completely ignored one of my major port cities.
I think he was just doing it by nation. Also, I imagine a few trade routes would go through the Lunusian Canal, so long as this isn\'t a restart and it\'s still there.
Warned you all, it was bad. I just picked what I thought were great ports and connected them. Considering it was based only off the nations map, so yeah.

I am so making a munar colony then selling the governing rights to it for a large amount of money.

ALSO MUNAR FACTORIES THAT I WILL RENT OUT SO TIM\_BARRETT CAN CONSTRUCT HIS MONSTROCITIES THERE

...And charge a massive amount of money for that, too. All of said money will go to building more colonies to earn more money and largely military.

Oh and ignore the nuke launching facility on the mun pls guise
Don\'t mind me I\'ll just be doing science... and airdropping supplies via ICBM.

> 
> Don\'t mind me I\'ll just be doing science... and airdropping supplies via ICBM.

Oh god... you might start Global Thermonuclear War! (Which would never happen, unless you want Kerbin full of radiation)

> 
> Warned you all, it was bad. I just picked what I thought were great ports and connected them. Considering it was based only off the nations map, so yeah.

There are two major canals in the Itaalican peninsula. One at the thinnest point of Masitas, one as the thinnest point of Lumos.

> 
> Oh god... you might start Global Thermonuclear War! (Which would never happen, unless you want Kerbin full of radiation)

Do you remember the civil war in... Choctico? Chocitco? Chocolate?

When I asked you if I could put my naval battlegroup into the Sea of Veiid?

> 
> There are two major canals in the Itaalican peninsula. One at the thinnest point of Masitas, one as the thinnest point of **Lumos**.

Lunus ![<_<](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_dry.png)
Sorry, it\'s just really similar to the religion I invented ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)
Wasn\'t RP reset? The canals shouldn\'t be there. If they somehow are in the game, then I failed badly.

> 
> Wasn\'t RP reset? The canals shouldn\'t be there. If they somehow are in the game, then I failed badly.

All events that happened before the crash and bang of the last forum stay. The canals exist because Masitas and Lunus built them, Atlaneigo never existed etc. Things that happened before this forum kicked out the RP don\'t stick, things that happened in the second .tk do.

> 
> All events that happened before the crash and bang of the last forum stay. The canals exist because Masitas and Lunus built them, Atlaneigo never existed etc. Things that happened before this forum kicked out the RP don\'t stick, things that happened in the second .tk do.

I cannot remember this, but I will take your word for it.
